lines.text: Be careful. You're a man who makes people afraid, and that's dangerous.
It's what people know about themselves inside that makes 'em afraid.
See here, you can't turn all these people out into the night. It is inhuman, brother. Inhuman!
I'm not your brother.
We are all brothers in the eyes of God.
All these people, are they your sisters and brothers?
They most certainly are.
...Then you won't mind if they come over and stay at your place, will ya?
What happens after?
Hmm?
What do we do when it's over?
Then you live with it.
I got 18 people in my hotel! Where are they gonna go?
Out.
You're going to look pretty silly with that knife sticking out of your ass.
A lot faster than you'll ever live to be.
Wonder what took her so long to get mad?
Because maybe you didn't go back for more?
I like chicken, fried.
I'd like rifles and ammunition for everyone in the regiment.
What regiment?
The city of Lago volunteer force
Never heard of it
Well you should have because your in it.
Your feet ma'am are almost as big as your mouth.
the stranger is on his way out of town. He stops at the cemetary, where Mordecai is chiseling a gravestone]
I'm just about done here.
[pause]
I never did know your name...
Yes, you do.
[Mordecai stares at the stranger, confused]
Take care.

[salutes]
Yes, sir, captain!
"MARSHAL JIM DUNCAN - REST IN PEACE"]
[first lines]
Beer... and a bottle.
Ain't much good, but it's all there is.
[brings drinks]
You want anything else?
Just a peaceful hour to drink it in.
They say the dead don't rest without a marker of some kind.
Well, I been needin' to talk with you; now's as good a time as any.
What about?
Billy Borders.
Don't know the man.
Well, you missed your chance; you shot him yesterday.
Bridges, you Carlin boys, don't forget your tickets back to my little hotel
[throws their guns and gun belts on the ground]
Don't worry, they ain't loaded.
What about our horses? We rode in here on three good animals.
What do you think you been eatin' the last six months.
[goes back in and closes the door]
Damn him! I didn't think I was eatin' my own horse! He's lying. That slop he fed us wasn't our horses. He stole 'em and sold 'em, that's what he done!
Shut up!
[smiles]
When we get to Lago, you can have the mayor's horse, fried or barbecued.
Billy, he wasn't a loved man. He didn't have much personality and what he did have was all bad.
Just what do you consider going too far? Isn't forcible rape in broad daylight a misdemeanor in this town?
I'd love to oblige you. But a man's got to get his rest sometime.
Oblige me?
But I tell you what, if you'd come back in about half hour, I'll see what I can do, all right?
I don't know if we shouldn't mark the grave somehow, Dan?
I don't see any need. It ain't likely anybody is gonna cry over them anyhow.

[the stranger has bought a round for the house]
Let's see, one round for the house plus the smoke; that comes to about eight dollars and fifty cents.

[chuckling]
There's no charge Lutie; you were at the meeting, anything he wants.
I didn't know that mean free whiskey!
Everybody's got to put something in the kitty.

[Reaches over a takes off Shaw's badge and pins it on Mordecai]
'Bout time this town had a new sheriff.
I'm the new sheriff!
[looks around the saloon]
I'm the new sheriff!

[laughing]
I'm sorry, Dan; but you should have seen the look on your face when he took off your badge and pinned it on the runt.
I'm not a runt anymore; I'm the new sheriff!

[reaches over and takes off the mayor's hat and puts it on Mordecai]
And the mayor. Any objections?
Uh, no.
Now, Morg. You just give us the combination to that safe in the mining office and we'll slip right in, get the money that's owed us and slip right back out again.

[dying]
I wouldn't give you the combination to the gates of hell.
[Stacy stabs him in the throat with a sharpened stick]

[after the Stranger blows up the hotel and shoots four men]
What the hell happened?
Somebody left the door open and the wrong dogs came home.
What did you say your name was again?
I didn't.
No. I guess you didn't at that, did you?

He can ride double with me 'til we come across some body else. Likely we'll all need fresh mounts anyway. They probably found those bodies by now and they'll be hot on our trail. We need to keep moving.
I just want enough time to take one year out of my life back from Lago.
How long you reckon that'll take?

[smiling]
For some of 'em; a lifetime.

[to The Stranger]
Who are you?

Will you never understand, woman? That wasn't anything we wanted to do. When Duncan found out the mine was on government property... it was just a technicality, really, but he was determined to turn us in. Wouldn't listen to reason.
Is that why? Is that really why it happened?

Don't you see, Sarah? They would have closed down the mine. Do you know what would've happened to this town then? It would've been the end of everything we've worked on. All of it, all of us. And you too, wife. Sometimes we have to do what's necessary to do... for the good of everybody. That's the price of progress.
And what's the price of a human life?

[drinking]
To your feet, Ma'am. They're not as big as your mouth.
he is on the ground, whipped brutally by Stacey Bridges and the Carlin brothers]
Somebody, please help me. Help me!
[the town people stand still and watch. None of them intervenes to help the sheriff]

[to the town people, in his last breath]
Damn you all to hell!
